annotations.excerpt: This is a convenient spot to smoke.
annotations.content: This is a convenient spot to smoke.

annotations.excerpt: Actually, I think the bus stops should be considered as
annotations.content: Actually, I think the bus stops should be considered as a special kind of buildings. If we don't allow people to smoke near the buildings, we definitely should prohibit smoking at bus stops.

annotations.excerpt: I agree that golf courses are not appropriate places for
annotations.content: I agree that golf courses are not appropriate places for smoking. But there still need to be some places reserved for the smokers anyways. As I suggest before, at least two things we can do: (1) set up some designated smoking areas for smokers, (2) make the smoking-free zones flexible, for instance, allowing them to smoke near the golf courses in the nights, but not in the days.

annotations.excerpt: I have noticed the same thing about the discarded butts
annotations.content: I have noticed the same thing about the discarded butts in the planters.  I think that if we agree to have designated smoking areas, Penn State should provide appropriate receptacles for butts.  I recently was walking into Waring commons and I saw there was a "Designated smoking area" outside of it.  I thought that this might be a good idea to just have a few designated smoking areas to keep the smokers and non-smokers at a happy medium.  The area did have a receptacle but I was concerned with how close to the entrance of the building it was.  This will encourage students to smoke right outside the door which is a high traffic area and will let smoke into the building.

annotations.excerpt: From what I have been reading, it doesn't look like
annotations.content: From what I have been reading, it doesn't look like they are proposing to make any of the golf course smokefree.  Even though I am strongly against smoking on our campus, I think it is appropriate to allow smoking on the golf course.

annotations.excerpt: Scott, you bring up a great point about whether people
annotations.content: Scott, you bring up a great point about whether people will cross the street to smoke at the golf course.  Bo has already seen this issue when his friend went to the golf course to try and smoke away from people.  I think that this helps to show that with a smoking ban on campus, people will resort to walking over to the golf course area to smoke.  This can cause a lot of congestion on the course, pose a safety risk to the people smoking, and would be unfair to the golfers.

annotations.excerpt: This planter is filled with cigarette butts and other small
annotations.content: This planter is filled with cigarette butts and other small trash.  If smoking is allowed and occurs frequently at certain locations like this, the university should provide a receptacle for butts.  This is one of the few locations on campus where I have noticed discarded butt.s

annotations.excerpt: This area provides tables and covered cigarette receptacles that can
annotations.content:
This area provides tables and covered cigarette receptacles that can be 
an attractive place for lunch or a break for both smokers and 
non-smokers.  However, the space can still create awkward scenarios 
where non-smokers are downwind and forced to tolerate second-hand smoke 
the same way this is likely to occur at bus stops.  Since it can be 
argued smoke is not without ill-effects and not just a matter of 
preference, it doesn't seem reasonable to create a shared space that 
leaves it up to the smoker to be considerate of others in the area 
depending on the situation.  It is hard to see a argument for public 
spaces like these that allow smoking if the physical space does not 
enable both smokers and non-smokers to enjoy the space (like windscreens 
or active ventilation at bus stops).  The expense of either then becomes 
the next hurdle for Penn State to justify.

annotations.content: Test Mike's error

annotations.excerpt: I agree.
annotations.content: I agree.

annotations.excerpt: I agree with this. And, even when smokers stand to
annotations.content: I agree with this. And, even when smokers stand to the side of the door, the smoke drifts back.

annotations.excerpt: Since you are not allowed to buy alcohol at the
annotations.content: Since you are not allowed to buy alcohol at the NCAA venues, such as Beaver Stadium and the Bryce Jordan Center, you also can not buy alcohol at the golf courses. If the campus goes smoke free, does that mean that folks can not smoke on the golf courses? Or, if the campus is smoke free, and the golf courses are not, does that mean there will be a crowd of people that walk across Atherton to smoke on the golf courses? Would this be fair to golfers that do not smoke or even safe?

annotations.excerpt: [Fictional] There was recently an incident where it was raining
annotations.content: [Fictional] There was recently an incident where it was raining and a few people were waiting at this bus stop.  One person was holding a small child and was inside the shelter to avoid the rain.  Another individual, who was smoking a cigarette, also ducked into the shelter.  This put the parent of the small child in a tough situation, as they did not want to stand out in the rain, but they also did not want their child inhaling second hand smoke.  This alone is a good enough reason for prohibiting smoking at bus stops.

annotations.excerpt: I see a handful of people smoking here.  Most are
annotations.content: I see a handful of people smoking here.  Most are considerate enough to stand downwind from the doors and paths.  If smoking areas are to be designated, there should be a natural wind block provided for each.

annotations.excerpt: The other day as I left Walker I was met
annotations.content: The other day as I left Walker I was met with a cloud of smoke.  People should at least not stand directly outside the door when smoking.

annotations.excerpt: The reason I brought this story up is that probably
annotations.content: The reason I brought this story up is that probably we should allow the smoke-free zones to be flexible and adaptive to different time slots. For example, in the daytime, the whole campus in the bigger Phase 3 block should be banned from smoking; however, in the late nights, since there are not so many people on campus, we might allow smoking outside the smaller Phase 2 block, but inside the Phase 3 block.

annotations.excerpt: This is a story from one of my friends who
annotations.content: This is a story from one of my friends who is a smoker. When he just came to State College 2 years ago, he was not quite familiar with the surrounding situations. One night around 11pm, he felt like to have a smoke, but he was not sure whether the campus was allowed for smoking. So he walked out from IST building to the nearby golf course (as I sketched on the map), and lid a cigarette. When he was enjoying the smoking, suddenly a police showed up and questioned him why he was out there in the late night. He had to explain and the police told him it was not safe to hang out in the night and let him leave. My friend was scared and he complained that if the whole campus was smoke-free, where should they smoke, especially in the nights?

annotations.excerpt: There is almost always someone smoking in this area by
annotations.content: There is almost always someone smoking in this area by the bus stop. I think Alan had brought up this issue about smoking at bus stops. This is a very problematic area.

annotations.excerpt: Do you mean all bus stops throughout the Centre Region?
annotations.content: Do you mean all bus stops throughout the Centre Region? I think this would be difficult as then the Borough, along with many townships would have to get involved.

annotations.excerpt: I agree, this is one of the most public places
annotations.content: I agree, this is one of the most public places where many people congregate. Therefore, one smoker could affect a large number of non-smokers.

annotations.excerpt: I use to live in Thompson Hall and people would
annotations.content: I use to live in Thompson Hall and people would smoke right outside the door I would walk in and out of multiple times in a day.  Everytime I had to walk through that door I was hit with a wall of smoke because the people that smoked generally stayed pretty close to the building.  I have had asthma almost all of my life so this smoke was very harmful to my lungs.

annotations.excerpt: Experience about smoking on campusPlease think about an experience you
annotations.content:
Experience about smoking on campus

Please think about an experience you have had with regards to smoking on campus.  For example, maybe you were leaving a class one day and people were smoking right outside the door of the building and it bothered you.  Or maybe someone yelled at you when you were smoking outside minding your own business. 

Come up with an experience that can be linked to a location on campus and post the annotation as a comment to this issue. Thanks!

annotations.excerpt: There seem to be an agreement on keeping all classroom
annotations.content: There seem to be an agreement on keeping all classroom buildings smoke-free, but we do not see the same for bus stops and large open spaces on campus.  Suggestions can be made on implementing the Phase I smoke-free areas.

annotations.excerpt: The three phases failed to consider yet another high risk
annotations.content: The three phases failed to consider yet another high risk area of secondary smoking, which is the bus stops.  It is unclear if there is any existing regulations about smoking at bus stops.  Any one know that?  I suggest we start this as a new issue.

annotations.excerpt: The three phases did not consider the fact of bus
annotations.content: The three phases did not consider the fact of bus stops on campus are also subject to risk of secondary smoking.  I propose to talk about the possibility of including bus stops

annotations.excerpt: I totally agree with you, Jim.  In fact I would
annotations.content: I totally agree with you, Jim.  In fact I would suggest that pathway outside the IST building (towards Pollack) should also be Smoke-Free, since many students pass by during rush hours.  Phase 1 is not specific enough

annotations.excerpt: I smelled smoke several time as I pass through the
annotations.content: I smelled smoke several time as I pass through the side door of the IST building.  This is obviously a candidate for smoke-free areas.  So I support the implementation of Phase 1 immediately

annotations.excerpt: There was some similar discussion for IST building. It is
annotations.content: There was some similar discussion for IST building. It is infeasible to assign restrooms as smoking zones.
